description.narrative: The development objective of the Additional Financing and Restructuring for the Community and Basic Health Project for Tajikistan will remain the same, i.e. to increase access to, utilization of, and patient satisfaction with health services in project-supported areas, and to build capacity and efficiency at national, oblast and rayon levels in administering a basic package of health benefits and introducing financing reforms in primary health care. More specifically, the Additional Financing (AF) will finance: 1) the completion of the Community and Basic Health Project (CBHP) investment, which would not be feasible otherwise due to the costs associated with higher than anticipated construction costs for health facilities; and 2) the scale up of activities started under the CBHP to ensure their sustainability, and support the development and implementation of the health sector strategy. The AF is expected to finance a combination of consultant services, medical and computer equipment, medical furniture, basic renovation of an office in oblast health department in Sughd, and training of health care staff in family medicine. The reasons for AF are two-fold, first to enable the completion of the original CBHP investments and activities, and second, to scale up and expand activities to maximize the development impact of the CBHP and support the development and the implementation of the health sector strategy.

condition.narrative: At all times during the implementation of the project, the Recipient shall maintain the PIU with a composition, resources, & termsof reference satisfactory to the Association
The Recipient has adopted the Project Operational Manual in form and substance satisfactory to the Association as an effectivenesscondition.

title.narrative: Share of health in household expenditure (overall and by household wealth quintiles) in project-supported oblasts as measured by household surveys.

actual.value: Tajikistan:6% Sughd: 4.8%Khatlon: 3.1%

comment.narrative: Target met based on last available data from TLSS 2007Achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of households in project supported oblasts who don't seek health care when necessary because they cannot afford it, as measured by household surveys.

baseline.value: Baseline, 2003 TLSS Tajikistan: 57%, Sughd 19% and Khatlon 13%

actual.value: 2007 TLSS: Sughd 49%; Khatlon 37%

comment.narrative: Target met for Khatlon Oblast based on currently available dataAchieved

title.narrative: Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)

comment.narrative: On track. Civil works on 5 additional PHC ongoing & to be completed by October, 2012
Cumulative total: 290 Doctors and 857 Nurses trained in Family Medicine. From 2011 to 2012: 30 Doctors and 222 Nurses from 3rayons. CME training for 280 Doctors and 857 Nurses from 9 pilot rayons
On track. As of April, 2012 cumulative total: 285 doctors and 768 nurses, including 196 doctors and 515 nurses (CBHP); 64 doctorsand 120 nurses (AF1); 25 doctors and 133 nurses (AF2)

title.narrative: Number of hospitals in project-supported rayons that have introduced BBP.

target.value: Sogd Oblast: All hospitals in 18 rayonsKhatlon Oblast:All hospitals in 2 rayons

actual.value: Spitamen - 3 hospitals;Sarband – 2 hospitals;Nurek – 1 CRHTotal 6 hospitals

comment.narrative: Achieved. The further expansion of the BBP to other districts is currently on hold, according to the Decree of the Gov. Of the RT№579 from 3.12.2011 “On the approval of BBP for 2012-2013”

title.narrative: Number of hospitals in project supported oblasts that have introduced HMIS with trained staff and commenced full utilization of a Health Management Information System

target.value: Not less than 210 facilities in the pilot rayons

actual.value: 249 inpatient depts equipped with computers and training organized; 680 health workers & accountants trained to use HMISsoftware.Targets fully met.

target.value: 251 secondary health care faciliities in 41 rayons

actual.value: 251 secondary health care offices in 41 rayons

title.narrative: Number of PHC departments in rayons in project-supported oblasts equipped with furniture and computers, and with staff trained and actively performing managerial duties

actual.value: 52 facilities in 41 rayons Managers, accountants and statistics 52 RHC/UHC Trainings on HMIS are ongoing until December 2010.

actual.value: Surveys completed

actual.value: Sughd: average indicator 4.2% and range is from 1.0% to 19.6 % Khatlon: average indicator 4.4% and range is from 2.2 % to10.1%

actual.value: 80% of planned activities completed , with the installation of updated accounting system and training planned for 2011
Final draft submitted to MOH by Dec 20, 2010. Activited completed under H461. (AF1).

target.value: 184 staff trained in 2 additional rayons under AF1; 252 staff trained in 3 addl rayons under AF2.
